sentences.en: Do nothing to offend her susceptibilities.
Faithful [ Frank ; Honest ] words offend the ear but are good for improving one's conduct.
He is very formidable; How could anybody be so brave as to offend him?
sentences.cn: 他可厉害了, 谁惹得起他 呀 !

sentences.en: He took care never to offend his visitors.
sentences.cn: 他小心谨慎,绝不得罪他的访客.

sentences.en: He wishes ill to no one except those who intentionally offend him.
sentences.cn: 他不盼任何人倒霉,除去那些有意冒犯他的人.

sentences.en: His remarks deeply offended many Scottish people.
sentences.cn: 他的话严重冒犯了许多苏格兰人。

sentences.en: I cannot afford to offend him.
I try to offend the least amount of people possible.
In Western countries girls are far less likely to offend than boys.
sentences.cn: 在西方国家，女孩们远不像男孩们那样容易犯罪。

sentences.en: Let us go, before we offend the connoisseurs.
sentences.cn: 咱们走吧, 免得我们惹恼了收藏家.

sentences.en: She dressed down to visit her poor relatives, so as not to offend them by a show of her wealth.
sentences.cn: 她拜访穷亲戚时穿得比较俭朴, 以免因摆阔而伤害他们的感情.

sentences.en: Strange that the sharp smell did not offend her nostrils now.
sentences.cn: 奇怪的是此刻强烈的酒味并不觉得刺鼻了.

sentences.en: Television censors are cutting out scenes which they claim may offend.
sentences.cn: 电视节目审查官正在剪掉他们称有可能会令人反感的一些镜头。

sentences.en: The careful language is designed not to offend.
sentences.cn: 使用谨慎的语言是为了不得罪人。

sentences.en: There can be little doubt that he will offend again.
sentences.cn: 毋庸置疑他还会再犯的。

sentences.en: Why did you walk away from me like that? H ave I said words to offend you?
sentences.cn: 你为什么要那样离开我 呢 ?我说的话惹你生气了 吗 ?

sentences.en: You might offend your hosts if you camp it up at the party in your usual way.
sentences.cn: 倘若你在晚会上像往常那样哗众取宠可能会冒犯主人.

sentences.en: You will offend him if you do that.
sentences.cn: 你要是这样做,会冒犯他的.

words.tran_cn: 攻击的；冒犯的；无礼的；讨厌的
犯罪，过错；进攻；触怒；引起反感的事物

trans.tran_cn: 冒犯，（使）反感/不快，违法，违背
trans.tran_en: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc

trans.tran_cn: 冒犯， 触犯， 得罪
trans.tran_en: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc

trans.tran_cn: 冒犯， 伤害…的感情； 使厌恶； 违反
trans.tran_en: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc
